result.execSummary:
The defendant Laila C Schiavo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Laila C Schiavo is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Laila C Schiavo was found guilty of 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).
  • Laila C Schiavo was found guilty of 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment and psychological evaluation.   
*  Pay fine of $300 and court costs including all applicable surcharges on each count.   Domestic Violence Surcharge ($100 ea applicable count).  
*  Submit to a DNA sample (unless previously provided) and pay surcharge.  
*  Advocate Counsel fees to be determined and repaid by the DE.
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
May not have violent contact with Donald S.

timeConds.notes: Commence Forthwith  -  With huber privileges.  Credit for 126 days

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Laila C Schiavo appeared with Attorney Gregory Bates. Defendant in custody. Attorney Tracey Lynn Braun appeared for the Prosecution. Clerk: N. Jurgens. 
MINUTES: Victim rights comliance; impact statements heard from both victims. The Court orders withheld sentence, defendant placed on probation for 30 months w/conds. As a CONDITION OF PROBATION, the court orders def. to serve nine (9) months in the KCJ with huber privs, forthwith, 126 days sentence credit. $300 fine plus court costs ordered, plus DNA surcharge, on each count.  Counts 1 & 5 to run concurrent to each other. Appeal rights given. Advocate counsel fees to be determined and repaid by the DE; civil judgment/tax intercept for non-payment.

Attorney Tracey Braun appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Gregory Bates.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  4:50pm-  Due to time constraints, Court adjourns matter to February 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Bond continued.
Reminder Notice returned for Laila C Schiavo.  Not deliverable as addressed.  Unable to forward.
Acknowledgment of Plea Offer/Agreement

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Gregory Bates.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  3:24pm-  Victim rights compliance.  Amended Criminal Complaint filed to include probable cause.  DE acknowledges receipt & waives reading.  Matter is resolved.  Defendant entered a plea of guilty to counts 1 & 5; found guilty by the court.  On the motion of the State, counts 2 & 4 are dismissed & count 3 is dismissed & read-in.  Presentence Investigation ordered.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 22, 2015 at 02:30 pm.  Bond continued.
Notice of Assignment of Judge returned for Laila C Schiavo.  No such number.  Unable to forward.

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Gregory Bates.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  10:05am-  Victim rights compliance.  Attorney Bates is requesting an adjournment to allow him time to discuss a possible resolution w/ the State.  Court grants request.  DA Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 21, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  Final pre-trial adjourned to December 11, 2014 at 03:00 pm.  Bond continued.
from DE    (Copy sent to DA's Office & Attorney Bates on 10/27/2014)
